page.title: 08SCHOOLS
page.content: Present school in Charnock Richard Anglican-aided.151 on roll.Five classes.Pre-fabricated structure;timber and concrete.Opened 1969,enlarged 1975. Old school built of stone in 1858. Benefactor James Darlington.Now the parish rooms,used as ;playgroup centre, youth club and baby clinic.Has two large rooms. Heskin Primary School founded 1597 as Pemberton's Grammar School by Sir James Pemberton,a local boy who had achieved the office of Lord Mayor of London.There is a Royal Charter to support the title "Grammar", although it is now a primary school.
